page.title: 16INFORMATION SYSTEMS
page.content: IN VILLAGE LIFE VERBAL COMMUNICATION IS STILL PARAMOUNT. APPROXIMATELY 95% POSSESS TELEPHONES. LIBRARIES ARE ESTABLISHED IN TENTERDEN AND ASHFORD AND A MOBILE LIBRARY SERVES THE VILLAGE. LOCAL MARKETS REMAIN CENTRES FOR THE EXCHANGE OF INFORMATION. BEING AN AGRICULTURAL AREA WHERE THE FARMS ARE FAIRLY LARGE (8OO HECTARES+) THE FARMERS AND ASSOCIATED SERVICES POSSESS COMPUTERS USED FOR DATA PROCESSING AND INFORMATION RETRIEVING. THE LOCAL N.F.U. HAS PRESTEL WHICH ENABLES FARMERS TO OBTAIN INSTANT INFORMTION REGARDING MARKET PRICES. UPDATING OF INFORMATION IS CENTRAL TO ALL N.F.U. MEETINGS. NEWSPAPERS ARE DELIVERED OR PURCHASED AT THE DAIRY AND THERE IS A FREE MONTHLY VILLAGE MAGAZINE PREPARED AND PRINTED BY VOLUNTEERS.
